audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a dramatic sound effect, reminiscent of a car crash or explosion. Transitioning into speech, a male voice announces, "Bold and beautiful, B&B spoilers for Thursday September 5th, find the Dollar Bill Spencer." The speaker continues explaining that Don Diamont is going to pay Thomas Forrester a visit he won't forget. The tone is informational, like a television show promo. A second male speaker starts in an angry tone, explaining that, "Bill is freaking livid." The speaker will let Thomas know "just what the phrase don't mess with a Spencer means."

The audio clip begins with a man speaking about reminding someone of the pain they brought to their own family, particularly his sister, Steffy Forrester and Jacqueline MacInnes Wood. The tone is serious. Then, another man with a different voice says that Thomas will be quick to remind Bill that he at least covered for Brooke, but unlike his dad, Bill won't be so easy to convince. The same serious tone is maintained. The clip then transitions to silence.

The clip begins with a male speaker stating, "of course, Thomas won't show it, but on the inside, he'll be shaking in his boots." He continues, saying Thomas "knows that he could very well be connected to the death of Emma Barber" and that "opens up a whole new can of worms." The speaker speaks in a conversational tone. The audio ends with a male stating "Yeah".

The clip starts with a male speaker wondering about "little Douglas Forrester." There's a tone of concern. A second male speaker follows, commenting sarcastically on someone named Thomas, suggesting indifference or neglect towards a child, and questioning if he has even asked about the kid. He then speaks of potential punishment within the justice system.

The clip begins with a male speaker setting up a situation where Daddy Ridge is going to visit someone in jail, saying it will be Katrina Bowden. Next, a male speaker explains that when confronted, Ridge does not deny that she was one of the main villains, but defends herself saying that "Thomas a villain too." Ridge responds, according to the speaker, "in only a way that a dad would," with anger and rage. Another speaker mentions, in an informative tone, that "in one corner," there are multiple people who believe that a little boy would be better off with them. Then, a male speaker mentions "in the other corner," Thomas Forester, who will not let go of the only thing he has in his life. A drawn out sigh is heard at the very end.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker introducing an interview with Bradley Bell from CBS Soaps. This speaker then quotes Bradley Bell saying "Douglas will be caught in the middle of all this" and continues summarizing the sentiments of Hope, Liam, and Brooke. A different male speaker then says "He already lost hope" and expresses concern about the Logans and the Spencers taking Douglas away. He ends by saying "It's going to be another fight to the finish", encouraging fans to tune in to find out what will happen next.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker previewing a scene from "The Bold and the Beautiful" for September 5th, 2019. He lists the characters: Bill Spencer, Don Diamont, and Thomas Forrester, Matthew Atkinson, specifying that Thomas is injured. This is followed by an exchange between a male and female speaker, with the male speaking first, then the female, and both seem to discuss Brooke Logan, Katherine Guli Laying, and the complex relationships of the characters in a conversational and slightly analytical tone.

The clip starts with a male speaker reading a news report with a neutral tone about "The Bold and the Beautiful" spoilers and Bill Spencer. He expresses that Bill has more to say to In about Thomas Forrester, and then sarcastically adds that "Bill doesn't care that Brooke Logan shoved Thomas off the cliff." There is another male speaker with a neutral voice who follows, summarizing that "Bill blames Thomas for what befell Hope Logan" and others. Then, a third male voice is heard stating that "Ridge reminded his wife that Thomas Forrester didn't steal that baby". The clip concludes.

The audio clip begins with a spoiler announcement from the show "The Bold and the Beautiful", highlighting a confrontation between Bill Spencer and Thomas Forrester in a hospital setting. Following the announcement, a man speaks, speculating that Bill won't be satisfied with Thomas's injuries and that Bill wants him behind bars.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating that "Bill wants every single one of the baby swap schemer in jail", adding that only two, Flo and Reese Buckingham, Wayne Brady, are so far imprisoned. This section is followed by another male speaker noting that "B&B spoiler show Rich threw down the photo of Flo and the Logan ladies" who "made her feel like dirt," emphasizing that "that's how Flo already was feeling". Then a male speaker voices the idea that Ridge is happy that Flo is in jail but wants to ensure that it's permanent. The speaker additionally says that Ridge doesn't like Flo trying to blame Thomas Forrester for her wrongs. The clip transitions to a man stating that, "she's one of the original partners in crime along with Reese." The speaker also says, "there's no excuse that Ridge will accept from felony Flo." Finally, the audio clip ends with what seems to be an unintelligible hum.

The clip begins with a male speaker describing a confrontation, noting that it involves "threats and pile on the guilt." The speaker continues with a stern and slightly dramatic tone, remarking that this talk will be featured in an episode and advising viewers to "look for this tough talk conversation".  Following this, a different male speaker encourages watching to see how it ends and foreshadows potential betrayals. Finally, the clip closes with another male speaker who mentions "tough threats" directed at Thomas Forrester.

The clip begins with a female speaker mentioning the tension between "Brook and Richard", and then stating "Brook scoffed as if unsure of what to say." The female speaker says that tension is understandable "because of the turmoil embroiling their children". Next Brook states that she really doesn't want to talk to Pam about it. Finally a male speaker says "Lee".

The clip opens with a sound, followed by dialogue. First, a male voice appears in the doorway, and a woman is surprised to see him. Another woman decides to leave. Alone with the first woman, the male speaker says "it looked like she'd been right about Thomas". The woman replies that "she hadn't wanted to be" and assumes that the man knew what had happened. He states that the perpetrators have to pay, including Thomas. He had arrived to tell it to Ridge and asks where Ridge is.
